question.questionA: Much branched annual herbs; spikelets of one flower, curved; inner bract tuberculate.
question.questionB: Woody-based perennials; spikelets of several flowers; inner bract not tuberculate.

question.questionA: Leaves  small, papillose, forming cushion-like rosettes at the top  of  short woody branches; inflorescence zig-zag in form, with some short sterile branches at the base.
question.questionB: Leaves not forming a cushion-like rosette; inflorescence not in the form of a zig-zag.

question.questionA: Sterile branches many; inner bract with brownish margin and hyaline tip; calyx teeth short and blunt.
question.questionB: Sterile branches few; inner bract with wide hyaline margin; calyx teeth prominent, uncinate.
